abstract: Google’s long-anticipated system would allow media companies to prevent their clips from being uploaded to YouTube without permission.
snippet: Google’s long-anticipated system would allow media companies to prevent their clips from being uploaded to YouTube without permission.
lead_paragraph: SAN BRUNO, Calif., Oct. 15 — Google is seeking to put an end to the copyright wars over online video.

headline.main: Google Takes Step on Video Copyrights
headline.print_headline: Google Takes Step on Video Copyrights

abstract: — Google has “formally introduced long-awaited technology that it said will help media companies to halt the unauthorized posting of their content by its YouTube unit,” Broadcasting & Cable reports.
lead_paragraph: — Google has “formally introduced long-awaited technology that it said will help media companies to halt the unauthorized posting of their content by its YouTube unit,” Broadcasting & Cable reports.

headline.main: Clips: YouTube, Ad Wars, Imus Back To TV?

abstract: Jerry Yang announced that Yahoo’s new strategy is the same as its old one: It wants to be your “starting point” for Web surfing and e-mail. He left out why people would start there.
snippet: Jerry Yang announced that Yahoo’s new strategy is the same as its old one: It wants to be your “starting point” for Web surfing and e-mail. He left out why people would start there.
lead_paragraph: Since Yahoo’s last chat with investors three months ago, the Internet world has been waiting for word from Jerry Yang: What is Yahoo going to be in a world where it competes with Google, Facebook and millions of bloggers?

headline.main: For Yahoo, There’s No Place Like Home (Page)
